Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Goblet
Description: Large goblet with flat bottom and thick walls (0,7 cm under the lip), which flare out slightly near the top. This black and red vessel was very carefully vertically burnished. The black band that decorates the rim varies in width and has faded off in areas. A red colouring covers the exterior surface and the upper section of the interior surface. The remainder of this surface is the same colour as the clay, which varies from light beige to pink. The colours of the exterior surface are maroon (lower section) and orange (upper section).
